sentences.sContent: It cost the country $4 million in lost productivity .
sentences.sCn: 它对该国造成了400万美元的生产力损失。

sentences.sContent: ...If private plans demanded similar productivity savings from providers...
...nursing homes and other providers by amounts comparable to the productivity savings routinely made in other industries with the help of new technologies and new ways to organize work...
...Optimists say that more robots will lead to greater productivity and economic growth...
...dull and dangerous tasks while offering increased productivity and safety...
...on the productivity and well-being of employees at Best Buy's corporate headquarters...
...tools and systems that will assist in achieving productivity increases...
...other employees may react by reducing their productivity as well...
...which has now equipped all of its fee earners to be able to work at maximum productivity when away from the offices whether that’s from home...

synos.tran: 生产力；[经]生产率；生产能力

phrases.pCn: 初级生产力；第一性生产力；基础生产力；初级生产率
全要素生产率；总要素生产力

remMethod.val: 以上两词均来自produce(v. 生产)

words.tran: 能生产的；生产的，生产性的；多产的；富有成效的
产品；结果；[数] 乘积；作品
制作人，制片人；生产者；发生器
赢利性；生产率，生产能力；多产性

trans.tranOther: the rate at which goods are produced, and the amount produced, especially in relation to the work, time, and money needed to produce them
